definition: to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: Used to take the place of hyphen in many occasions when finer typography is required.
sentences.chinese: 很多时，配合精细的排字要求，就用它来代替连字号。

sentences.english: Hyphens are just used to separate the hexadecimal digits for the sake of clarity.
sentences.chinese: 连字号纯粹为了清晰的缘故而把十六进制数字分开。

sentences.english: Words are broken and hyphenated according to standard grammar rules.
sentences.chinese: 文字会根据标准文法规则断字并加上连字号。

sentences.english: The dash is longer than the hyphen.
Separate words with a hyphen and try not to use too many hyphens.
sentences.chinese: 单独的字词，以连字符和尽量不要使用太多的连字号。

definition: Chinese guillemet 《》(punct. used for names of books etc)
dash/Chinese dash ── (punct., double the length of the western dash)
